parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The address of the owner of the assets

parameters.name: token_ids
parameters.description: An array of token IDs to search for (e.g. `?token_ids=1&token_ids=209`). Will return a list of assets with token_id matching any of the IDs in this array.

parameters.name: asset_contract_address
parameters.description: The NFT contract address for the assets

parameters.name: asset_contract_addresses
parameters.description: An array of contract addresses to search for (e.g. `?asset_contract_addresses=0x1...&asset_contract_addresses=0x2...`). Will return a list of assets with contracts matching any of the addresses in this array. If "token_ids" is also specified, then it will only return assets that match each `(address, token_id)` pairing, respecting order.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: How to order the assets returned. By default, the API returns the fastest ordering. Options you can set are `sale_date` (the last sale's transaction's timestamp), `sale_count` (number of sales), and `sale_price` (the last sale's `total_price`)

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description: Can be `asc` for ascending or `desc` for descending

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit. Defaults to 20, capped at 50.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Limit responses to members of a collection.  Case sensitive and must match the collection slug exactly. Will return all assets from all contracts in a collection.  For more information on collections, see our [collections documentation](/reference#retrieving-collections).

parameters.name: include_orders
parameters.description: A flag determining if order information should be included in the response.  **Note:** As of May 25, orders from the Seaport contract will be returned in the `seaport_sell_orders` field, instead of the `sell_orders` field. Please refer to the [Seaport Order model](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/model-reference) for schema details.

parameters.name: asset_contract_address
parameters.description: The NFT contract address for the assets for which to show events

parameters.name: collection_slug
parameters.description: Limit responses to events from a collection.  Case sensitive and must match the collection slug exactly. Will return all assets from all contracts in a collection.  For more information on collections, see our [collections documentation](/reference#retrieving-collections).

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: The token's id to optionally filter by

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: A user account's wallet address to filter for events on an account

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The event type to filter. Can be `created` for new auctions, `successful` for sales, `cancelled`, `bid_entered`, `bid_withdrawn`, `transfer`, or `approve`

parameters.name: only_opensea
parameters.description: Restrict to events on OpenSea auctions. Can be `true` or `false`

parameters.name: auction_type
parameters.description: Filter by an auction type. Can be `english` for English Auctions, `dutch` for fixed-price and declining-price sell orders (Dutch Auctions), or `min-price` for CryptoPunks bidding auctions.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit for pagination

parameters.name: occurred_before
parameters.description: Only show events listed before this timestamp. Seconds since the Unix epoch.

parameters.name: occurred_after
parameters.description: Only show events listed after this timestamp. Seconds since the Unix epoch.

parameters.name: asset_owner
parameters.description: A wallet address. If specified, will return collections where the owner owns at least one asset belonging to smart contracts in the collection. The number of assets the account owns is shown as `owned_asset_count` for each collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: For pagination. Number of contracts offset from the beginning of the result list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination. Maximum number of contracts to return.

parameters.name: on_sale
parameters.description: If set to `true`, only show bundles currently on sale. If set to `false`, only show bundles that have been sold or cancelled.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Account address of the owner of a bundle (and all assets within)

parameters.name: asset_contract_address
parameters.description: Contract address of all the assets in a bundle. Only works for homogenous bundles, not mixed ones.

parameters.name: asset_contract_addresses
parameters.description: An array of contract addresses to search for (e.g. `?asset_contract_addresses=0x1...&asset_contract_addresses=0x2...`). Will return a list of bundles with assets having contracts that match ALL of the addresses in this array. Useful for querying for mixed bundles, e.g. ones with CryptoKitties AND CK Talisman statues.

parameters.name: token_ids
parameters.description: A list of token IDs for showing only bundles with at least one of the token IDs in the list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination: how many results to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: For pagination: the index of the result to start at (beginning with 0)

parameters.name: asset_contract_address
parameters.description: Address of the contract for this NFT

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: Token ID for this item

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: Address of an owner of the token.  If you include this, the response will include an `ownership` object that includes the number of tokens owned by the address provided instead of the `top_ownerships` object included in the standard response, which provides the number of tokens owned by each of the 10 addresses with the greatest supply of the token..

parameters.name: asset_contract_address
parameters.description: Address of the contract

parameters.name: collection_slug
parameters.description: The collection slug of this collection that is used to uniquely link to this collection on OpenSea

parameters.name: collection_slug
parameters.description: The collection slug
